content.p: {{name}} used ${{principal}} to open a bank account with an annual interest rate of {{interest_percent}}%, compounded {{compounding_times}}. How much money will they have in the account after {{interest_time}} years? Round you answer to the nearest cent.

outtro.p: After {{interest_time}} years, {{name}} will have {{future_value}} in the bank account. This uses the formula A(t) = A_0(1 + \frac{r}{n})^{nt}, where A_0 is the initial amount in the account, r is the annual interest rate (written as a decimal), n is the number of times the interest compounds per year, and t is the number of years.
